formatted_items.content:
Subject: Grandview University – Overview of Disability Accommodation Services

Dear Mr. Thompson,

Thank you for reaching out regarding Grandview University’s disability-accommodation policies and practices. I’m pleased to provide the information you requested for the current federal audit. A condensed overview appears below, and a more detailed, source-document repository (policies, usage statistics, and training materials) is available in my Notion workspace. If you would like direct access, please let me know and I will share the link immediately.

1. Disability Services Office (DSO)
• Central point of contact for students, staff, and faculty regarding accommodations.
• Staffed by two full-time coordinators, one assistive-technology specialist, and four graduate assistants.
• Hours: Monday–Friday, 8 a.m.–5 p.m.; 24/7 emergency hotline in collaboration with Campus Safety.

2. Accommodation Request & Approval Process
• Requests submitted through our secure online portal (compatible with screen readers).
• Average processing time: 5 business days for standard requests; 48 hours for time-sensitive cases.
• Documentation reviewed under the guidelines of ADA, Section 504, and relevant OCR case law.

3. Common Academic Accommodations
• Extended time, reduced-distraction testing environments, and alternative formats (Braille, large print, audio, digital).
• Note-taking support via Glean, Sonocent Audio Notetaker, and peer note-sharing.
• Captioning and ASL interpretation for in-person and online courses.

4. Housing & Dining
• ADA-compliant residence halls with accessible rooms on all floors.
• Priority room selection for students with mobility or medical needs.
• Dining services provide allergen-free and medically tailored meals; menus available in large print/Braille.

5. Physical & Digital Accessibility
• All new construction and major renovations meet 2010 ADA Standards.
• Annual audit of curb cuts, elevators, and signage conducted each July.
• LMS (Canvas) templates vetted for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance; faculty receive mandatory training.

6. Assistive Technology
• Campus-wide licenses: Kurzweil 3000, JAWS, Dragon NaturallySpeaking, and Read&Write.
• Lending library of smart pens, FM systems, and accessible calculators.
• On-site training every semester for new users.

7. Training & Awareness
• Required annual training for faculty and staff; completion rate 98 % last academic year.
• First-year orientation module for students covers accommodation procedures and disability etiquette.

8. Grievance & Appeal Procedures
• Formal grievance policy posted publicly; average resolution time 10 business days.
• Independent ADA/504 Compliance Officer reports directly to the Provost.

Next Steps
• If you need specific data (e.g., anonymized accommodation counts, faculty-training logs, or recent accessibility audits), please indicate and I will forward the relevant files.
• Let me know if a site visit or virtual walkthrough of accessible facilities would be helpful; I can arrange either at your convenience.

Thank you for your work on behalf of students with disabilities across the country. I stand ready to provide any further documentation or clarification you may require.

Best regards,

Dr. John P. [Last Name]
Professor of Education & ADA/504 Faculty Liaison
Grandview University
john.[lastname]@grandview.edu | (555) 123-4567
